definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: This is an ambitious agenda: But can it be done?
sentences.chinese: 這是一項雄心勃勃的議程，但它是否能夠實現呢？

sentences.english: Luring back high-fliers such as Mr Chau would be a start.
sentences.chinese: 吸引像吳寶珠這樣雄心勃勃的人回國將是一個開端。

sentences.english: Freud was a good student, and very ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德是一位雄心勃勃的優秀學生。

sentences.english: 'We are very aggressive in our expansion in China, ' Mr. Andersen said.
sentences.chinese: 安德生說，我們對於在中國的發展雄心勃勃。

sentences.english: Being ambitious and diligent, he is sure to get there .
sentences.chinese: 他雄心勃勃又勤奮好學，一定會有成就的。

sentences.english: Like many young and ambitious people, I made up my mind to study abroad.
sentences.chinese: 和許多雄心勃勃的年輕人一樣，我決心出國留學。

sentences.english: The seven-person crew aboard Endeavour lifted off during a rare nighttime launch from Kennedy Space Center in Florida.
sentences.chinese: 美國奮進號航天飛機開始了一次雄心勃勃的太空使命。

sentences.english: For Rotterdam it re-opens the window to ambitious architecture.
sentences.chinese: 鹿特丹公約重新打開窗口，雄心勃勃的架構。

sentences.english: The agenda is ambitious, asit has to be.
sentences.chinese: 該議程是雄心勃勃的，這也是必須的。

sentences.english: It was the start of the most ambitious scientific experiment in history.
sentences.chinese: 這是歷史上最雄心勃勃的一項科學實驗的開始。

sentences.english: I have the ambition to inherit some property.
sentences.chinese: 我雄心勃勃想繼承一些財產。

sentences.english: Hilary is also an ambitious50 girl.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里也是一個雄心勃勃的女孩。

sentences.english: However, Nur al-Din was not alone in facing ambitious underlings.
sentences.chinese: 但努爾丁是不會獨自面對這位雄心勃勃的下屬的。

sentences.english: The RTC seemed controversial and ambitious at the time.
sentences.chinese: 那時的RTC似乎是引發爭議且雄心勃勃的。

sentences.english: The result of our ambitious project will amaze the community.
sentences.chinese: 這一雄心勃勃的項目定能創造出令世人驚歎的成果。

definition: enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
to recruit soldiers and buy horses (idiom); to raise a large army/fig. to expand business/to recruit new staff
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
lit. deep plans and distant thoughts/to plan far ahead (idiom)
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
the task of establishing and maintaining hegemony
